item.title: 塔吉特公司扩充董事会，吸纳前耐克和汉斯品牌高管
item.description: 塔吉特公司周四选举两名新董事加入董事会，此举为迈克尔·菲德尔克将于二月出任该公司首席执行官铺路。【原文：Target on Thursday elected two new directors to its board ahead of Michael Fiddelke's ascension as the retailer's chief executive in February.】

item.title: 深海采矿公司依据特朗普政府新规申请国际许可
item.description: 周四，金属公司成为首家根据本周早些时候推出的简化许可程序，向华盛顿申请开采国际海底矿产的深海采矿企业。【原文：The Metals Co on Thursday became the first deep-sea miner to seek Washington's approval to mine the international seabed under a streamlined permitting process introduced earlier this week.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉拟推石油改革方案，赋予企业自主运营权，允许现金交易——文件显示
item.description: 路透社周四获得的草案显示，委内瑞拉拟对碳氢化合物法进行重大改革，允许外国和本土公司通过新型合同模式独立运营油田，实现石油产品商业化销售，并获得销售收益——即便其作为国有石油公司PDVSA的少数股东。【原文：A profound proposed reform of Venezuela's hydrocarbons law would allow foreign and local companies to operate oilfields on their own through a new contract model, commercialize output and receive sale proceeds even if acting as minority partners of state company PDVSA, drafts seen by Reuters on Thursday showed.】

item.title: 国会就医疗保险可负担性问题向保险公司高管施压
item.description: 美国五大健康保险公司的高管于周四开始向众议院和参议院议员作证，阐述美国医疗成本不断攀升以及民众医疗负担能力持续下降的问题。【原文：Top executives from five of the nation’s largest health insurers began testifying on Thursday to lawmakers in both the U.S. House of Representatives and Senate about the rising costs of Americans’ healthcare and declining affordability.】

item.title: 美国消费者支出在10月和11月稳健增长
item.description: 美国消费者支出在10月和11月均实现稳健增长，这可能使经济保持连续三个季度强劲增长的势头。【原文：U.S. consumer spending increased solidly in November and October, likely keeping the economy on track for a third straight quarter of strong growth.】

item.title: 西班牙再次终止"飞马"间谍软件调查，称以色列未予回应
item.description: 西班牙高等法院周四宣布终止对以色列网络情报公司NSO集团"飞马"软件用于监视西班牙政界人士的调查，理由是以色列当局未予配合。【原文：Spain's High Court on Thursday closed its investigation into the use of Israeli cyber-intelligence firm NSO Group's "Pegasus" software to spy on Spanish politicians, citing a lack of cooperation from Israeli authorities.】

item.title: 花旗称美国金融科技行业或因特朗普推动可负担性议程而受益
item.description: 花旗分析师在一份报告中指出，随着华盛顿在2026年11月中期选举前推行更注重民粹主义和可负担性的议程，美国金融科技股或将获得优势。【原文：U.S. fintech stocks could gain an edge as Washington leans into a more populist, affordability-driven agenda ahead of the November ​2026 midterm elections, analysts at Citigroup said in a note.】

item.title: 英国法院批准对大型数据中心提出质疑
item.description: 英国政府批准在伦敦郊外建设超大规模数据中心的决定将面临审查，此前活动人士于周四获准就该项目发起首例同类法律诉讼。【原文：Britain's approval for a hyperscale data centre just outside London will come under scrutiny, after campaigners were on Thursday granted permission to bring a first of its kind legal challenge over the project.】

item.title: 美国第三季度经济增长率小幅上调
item.description: 美国政府周四表示，第三季度美国经济增速略高于最初预期，同时企业利润数据也上调。【原文：The U.S. economy grew a bit faster than initially thought in the third quarter, the government said on Thursday, while corporate profits ​were also revised higher.】

item.title: 设计软件制造商欧特克将裁减约7%的全球员工
item.description: 设计软件制造商欧特克周四宣布，将裁减全球约7%的员工，即约1000名员工，其中大部分裁员将发生在面向客户的销售职能部门。【原文：Design software maker ‌Autodesk said on Thursday it would lay off about 7% ‌of its workforce globally, ​or roughly 1,000 employees, with a major ‍portion of the reductions occurring within its customer-facing ⁠sales functions.】

item.title: 通用汽车将别克SUV的生产从中国转移至美国
item.description: 通用汽车正将一款中国产别克SUV的生产转移至美国，这是该公司为应对特朗普政府关税政策而扩大美国工厂产能的最新举措。【原文：General Motors is moving production of a China-built Buick SUV to the U.S., its latest move to expand U.S. factory work in the wake of the Trump administration’s tariffs.】

item.title: Spotify在美国和加拿大为高级用户推出人工智能驱动的"提示式播放列表"
item.description: Spotify于周四在美国和加拿大推出"智能推荐歌单"功能，这项基于人工智能的技术可让高级用户根据个人收听习惯和指令定制专属歌单。【原文：Spotify on Thursday rolled out "prompted playlist", an artificial intelligence-powered feature in the United States and Canada that allows premium users tailor playlists using their listening habits and commands.】

item.title: Venture Global在西班牙雷普索尔公司提起的仲裁案中胜诉后股价上涨
item.description: 周四，Venture Global股价飙升近8%，此前仲裁庭在该公司与西班牙雷普索尔公司的纠纷中作出有利于这家美国液化天然气供应商的裁决。【原文：Venture Global's shares surged nearly 8% on Thursday after an arbitration tribunal ruled in favor of the U.S. liquefied natural ​gas supplier in a dispute with Spain's Repsol .】

item.title: 据CNBC报道，精神航空正与Castlelake就潜在收购事宜进行谈判。
item.description: 据CNBC新闻周四报道，知情人士透露，精神航空正与投资公司Castlelake就潜在收购事宜进行谈判，该航空公司目前处于破产状态。【原文：Spirit Airlines is in talks with investment firm Castlelake for a potential takeover of the bankrupt carrier, ​CNBC News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the ‌matter.】

item.title: 美国当周初请失业金人数小幅上升，第三季度GDP增速上调
item.description: 上周美国初请失业金人数小幅上升，表明1月份劳动力市场就业增长可能保持稳定步伐。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased marginally last week, suggesting the labor market likely maintained a steady pace of job growth in January.】

item.title: 通用电气航空首席执行官反驳航空公司对发动机定价权的批评
item.description: 通用电气航空集团首席执行官拉里·考普周四为喷气发动机行业的定价做法辩护，反驳航空业关于维护成本飙升和发动机短缺正使企业经营陷入困境的抱怨。【原文：GE Aerospace CEO Larry Culp on Thursday defended the jet-engine industry's pricing practices against airline industry complaints that soaring maintenance costs and engine shortages are straining their businesses.】

item.title: 卖掉美国？数据显示2025年欧洲买家蜂拥购入美国国债
item.description: 据花旗集团追踪的投资组合数据显示，去年4月至11月期间，欧洲投资者购买美国国债的份额占外国投资者总购买量的80%，这表明在去年市场动荡期间，该地区对"抛售美国资产"的交易兴趣寥寥。【原文：Europe accounted for 80% of foreign buying of U.S. Treasuries from April to November ‌last year, according to portfolio data tracked by Citi, suggesting little interest in the region for the 'Sell America' trade during last year's market turmoil.】

item.title: 自由港麦克莫兰公司季度利润超预期，得益于铜价上涨
item.description: 矿业公司自由港麦克莫兰周四公布的第四季度利润超出华尔街预期，得益于铜价上涨。【原文：Miner Freeport-McMoRan beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, boosted by higher copper prices.】

item.title: 派拉蒙将对华纳兄弟的敌意收购截止日期延长至2月20日
item.description: 派拉蒙与天空舞影业周四将对华纳兄弟探索公司的敌意收购要约截止日期延长至2月20日，以此争取更多时间说服投资者，其对这家好莱坞制片厂的收购要约优于网飞提出的竞争性交易方案。【原文：Paramount Skydance on Thursday extended the deadline on its hostile tender offer for Warner Bros Discovery to February 20, giving it more time to persuade investors that its bid for the Hollywood studio trumps a rival deal with Netflix.】

item.title: 科鲁拉酱料制造商麦考密克公司预测，受关税和投入成本上升影响，年度利润将疲软。
item.description: 辣酱制造商麦考密克周四预测，2026财年利润将低于分析师预期。在宏观经济不确定性加剧的背景下，关税和商品价格上涨导致成本上升，挤压了企业利润空间。【原文：Hot sauce maker McCormick on Thursday forecast fiscal 2026 profit below analysts' estimates, as higher costs from tariffs and commodities squeeze margins amid macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 哈塞特表示，新任美联储主席应是"独立人士"，且尊重法定职责。
item.description: 白宫顾问凯文·哈塞特——这位角逐美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔继任者的候选人之一——周四接受CNBC采访时表示，美联储新任主席应是"尊重法定职责的独立人士"。【原文：White House adviser Kevin Hassett, one of the candidates in the running to replace Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, told CNBC in an interview on Thursday that the central bank's new chair should be "an independent person who respects the mandates".】

item.title: 哥伦比亚暂停电力销售，对厄瓜多尔征收30%关税，贸易争端不断升级
item.description: 哥伦比亚周四早间宣布，将对厄瓜多尔的20种产品征收30%的关税，并已暂停向该邻国出售电力。此前一天，厄瓜多尔以哥伦比亚未能共同打击毒品走私为由对哥产品加征关税，哥伦比亚政府对此指控予以坚决驳斥。【原文：Colombia said early on Thursday that it will impose a 30% tariff on 20 products from Ecuador and that it has suspended electricity sales to the neighboring country, a day after Ecuador announced charges on Colombian products because of the alleged failure to work together against drug trafficking, an allegation the Colombian government has roundly rejected.】

item.title: 印度赛英公司季度利润下滑，因一次性劳动法相关费用
item.description: 印度赛英公司周四报告称，受该国新修订劳动法规产生的一次性费用影响，其第三季度利润下滑24.9%。【原文：India's Cyient reported a 24.9% fall in third-quarter profit on Thursday due to a one-time charge from the country's new revised labour codes.】

item.title: Mobileye预测年度营收低于预期
item.description: 自动驾驶技术公司Mobileye Global周四预测其年度营收将低于华尔街预期，这表明电动汽车产量放缓正对其驾驶辅助技术的需求造成压力。【原文：Self-driving tech company Mobileye Global forecast annual revenue below Wall Street expectations on Thursday, a sign that slower electric-vehicle production is weighing on demand for its driver assistance technology.】

item.title: 宝洁公司营收略低于预期，但经调整利润超出目标值
item.description: 宝洁公司周四公布的第二季度营收略低于华尔街预期，主要受美国洗衣液和卫生纸等核心品类消费疲软拖累，其美容产品业务的强劲表现未能抵消这一影响。【原文：Procter & Gamble on Thursday fell just short of Wall ​Street expectations for its second-quarter revenue, held back by weak consumer spending in core categories such as ‌U.S. laundry detergent and toilet paper, which overshadowed strength in its beauty products.】

item.title: 地缘政治动荡或将考验欧元区银行外汇融资能力，风险机构警告
item.description: 欧洲系统性风险委员会周四警告称，若地缘政治不确定性持续高企，欧元区银行可能难以在市场上融资，尤其是在美元及其他外币融资方面。【原文：Euro area banks might find it hard to finance themselves on the market, particularly in U.S. dollars and other foreign currencies, if high geopolitical uncertainty persists, the European Systemic Risk Board warned on Thursday.】

item.title: 晨间报价：达沃斯放松
item.description: 当今美国及全球市场中真正重要的因素【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 独家：欧盟-南共市协定或将于3月起临时生效
item.description: 欧盟一名外交官周四向路透社透露，尽管欧盟最高法院即将对此案作出裁决，欧盟与南美国家签署的自由贸易协定很可能最早于3月开始临时实施。【原文：The EU's free trade deal with South American countries will probably be applied on a ​provisional basis as soon as March, an EU diplomat ‌told Reuters on Thursday, despite a looming challenge at the bloc's top court.】

item.title: 通用电气航空预测2026年利润将因售后市场强劲表现而超出预期
item.description: 通用电气航空周四预测年度利润将超出预期，主要得益于高利润率售后零部件及服务需求的强劲增长。由于飞机供应受限，航空公司预计将优先考虑维护支出。【原文：GE Aerospace forecast annual profit above estimates on Thursday, driven by strong demand for high-margin aftermarket parts and services as ​airlines are expected to prioritize maintenance spending due to aircraft supply constraints.】

item.title: 期货价格因格陵兰岛救灾消息进一步上涨
item.description: 美国股市期货周四上涨，显示华尔街出现新的买盘动能。此前美国总统特朗普放弃对欧洲国家加征关税的威胁，缓解了市场对新一轮全球贸易战的担忧。【原文：U.S. ​stock index futures rose on Thursday, signaling fresh buying momentum on Wall ‌Street after President Donald Trump backed down from threats to impose tariffs against European countries, easing concerns about a new global trade war.】
